data.title: Authentic Eau Claire Coffee Shop
data.text: I go to this coffee shop every time I am in Eau Claire on business and it never disappoints. It is situated in the Lismore Hilton hotel lobby with separate street entrance and urban alternative vibe. Great local cafe with excellent quality coffee but they also have many assorted teas and smoothies as well as pastries and some pre-packaged food from the Informalist restaurant. Love the yogurt mango parfait for breakfast and they also make a delicious warm breakfast burrito. Cookies and muffins are ok, sometimes dry and look like they have been left out too long...a few times I have seen flies in the glass pastry containers - yuck. Otherwise I love this place and don't know what I would do without my daily latte here every morning while staying at the Hilton Lismore.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at Eau Claire Downtown Coffee, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We're very pleased you enjoy ECDC! We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit to EC! We have addressed the two concerns you had and should no longer be a problem...thanks very much for your input.
Kind Regards, Terry V.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Conveient to hotel
data.text:
I stayed in the hotel and went to the shop for a morning mocha. The mocha was smooth and not scalding hot, very good! 

The space is quite nice. I didn't hang out in the coffee shop area but sat in the adjacent hotel lobby area. There was a variety of seating; long couches, individual chairs, and a long table with chairs. 

The shop had an interesting menu and I would imagine it to be handy if I were traveling on business or going to eat in my room. They even sold beer in the coffee shop (I love WI)!

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at Eau Claire Downtown Coffee, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello and Thanks for your kind review! We very pleased you enjoyed EC DC! We look forward to seeing you soon!
Kind Regards, Terry V.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Pricey
data.text: Ordered a coffee drink, 2 juices and 3 muffins and bill came to $30.00.  Way to expensive for Eau Claire, WI.  Quality was average.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at Eau Claire Downtown Coffee, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Our fresh squeezed juices are $4. Our in house bakery bakes fresh muffins daily and they are $3 and our most expensive coffee drink (a lg breve) is $5.50. We use the best organic dairy products from Castle Rock and our coffee is top of the line Tiny Footprint coffee that our friends at Roastery 7 roast specifically for us. We want to present the best quality products we possibly can to our guests. My apologies for not meeting your expectation. We hope to win you as a continuing guest.
Kind Regards, Terry V.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: good but not great coffee
data.text: Latte was rather burned/off taste, didn't go back, but it could be they were still learning. Atmosphere was nice, and service was friendly.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at Eau Claire Downtown Coffee, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for your input and my apologies. Please, always feel free to bring this the barista's attention and we will gladly remake. Consist excellence is our goal that we're working towards and we will use this information to help that process.

Best Regards and we look forward to seeing you soon.
Terry V.
owner/gm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Quick and tasty options
data.text: Enjoyed coffee options at the ECDC. Also, they had an amazing yogurt parfait and pumpkin muffins.  Everything is locally grown or purchased--loved it!

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at Eau Claire Downtown Coffee, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks so much for your kind words! We're glad you loved it! That's what we're shooting for!

Best Regards and Cheers!
Terry V.
owner/gm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best Part of the Lismore
data.text: My boyfriend is a bit of an espresso junkie, and we didn't realize this place would be so good when we booked a room at the Lismore Hotel (in the same building). We were very pleasantly surprised by it! I can't say I loved the mocha, but he was impressed by the baristas and their knowledge of how to pull different espresso drinks (some more than others, of course). Highly recommend this spot as a great place to get your morning fix. I had a tasty scone, as well.

owner_response.author: Terry V, General Manager at Eau Claire Downtown Coffee, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for your kind words! Thank you very much for recommending EC DC!

We look forward to seeing you again soon!
Best Regards,
Terry V.
owner/gm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great food and Coffee--Mediocre service at best.
data.text: We really were excited this addition to downtown Eau Claire, and the coffee was great as was the sandwich, but the service left a lot to be desired.  The staff seem to distracted and disinterested to wait on us, and were less than enthusiastic to serve us.  I'll come back, as I hope it was just one bad experience.

owner_response.author: Terry V, General Manager at Eau Claire Downtown Coffee, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Although I'm very gratified that you enjoyed the food and coffee, I'm disappointed in hearing about the level of service you received. We will be using this as a training tool to improve. I appreciate your input and look forward to showing you a warmer, more inviting atmosphere in EC DC on your next visit.

Thanks and Best Regards, 
Terry V.
owner/gm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good coffee but way too noisy!
data.text: Coffee and food here are good. The ambiance: terrible! I know that it is all about being the new hipster coffee place in town with cement floors and metal decor and big windows but it creates a place that is impossibly noisy to enjoy a conversation with a friend. The acoustic result is a cacophony of sound. Plus, the morning we visited there were a few young moms with toddlers. Moms were completely engrossed in their phones and each other while toddlers trashed the surrounding area grinding cookies into the fabric chairs, spilling beverages, etc... Not a pleasant experience.

owner_response.author: Terry V, Owner at Eau Claire Downtown Coffee, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We're sorry you had a less than enjoyable experience with us. I appreciate your input and will take this into consideration as we are looking to make this space warm and inviting to all.

Best Regards and Thanks, 
Terry V.
owner/gm
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: BEST COFFEE IN EC
data.text: I have been to almost every coffee shop in EC. I'm definitely a coffee junkie. I would have to say this is the best coffee. The atmosphere is very modern and business oriented. Many people have casual business meetings here. It's also a great spot to sit and study if you're a college student. I always receiver great service as well. Definitely would recommend.

owner_response.author: Harlie J, Public Relations Manager at Eau Claire Downtown Coffee, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Katelyn! Thanks for stopping by and leaving a review on TripAdvisor. We really appreciate it! I'll make sure to share this with our staff. See you around!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Bitter espresso
data.text: The baristas are not well seasoned here. I had a flat white, which is my go-to drink, and the espresso was very bitter and definitely not pulled right. The decor is cute and the baristas are friendly enough. But if you're an aficionado, there are better places to go.

owner_response.author: Harlie J, Public Relations Manager at Eau Claire Downtown Coffee, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello! Thanks for leaving a review! We welcome you back to have a flat white on us. We are always looking to improve and would love your insight!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Espresso was very smooth - had almond milk which was a delight. Staff was very friendly and even gave us recommendations on other restaurants! Purple power smoothie was very fruity and smooth. 😻 will return.

owner_response.author: Harlie J, Public Relations Manager at Eau Claire Downtown Coffee, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Carley! Glad you had a great experience. We look forward to your return. See you around.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Well Decorated; Poor Products
data.text:
This coffee shop has a smart atmosphere with small but functional tables and chairs, but it's product was average. I entered at 9:00 am in the morning. Parking downtown was not a problem but seating in this establishment was. Using spare, sleek furniture, there were wide spaces in the lobby of the coffee shop but few seats. Only bar stools were left as business men had staked out one of the few tables with their briefcases. The chairs were comfortable, but the bar stools somewhat unwieldy. I ordered only two items: cappachino & blueberry muffin. The muffin appeared tasty and moist but was dry and flavor lacked definition. The blueberries were colorful but tasteless.  The exterior of the muffin had odd patches of a bitter tasting substance as if something like baking soda/powder had not been integrated well into the batter.  The cappachino was tasty.  It was as if they hired someone to make everything give the appearance of a hip coffee shop but no discerning taste.  

Their website says they have wifi. There was no distinct network resembling the name of the coffee shop that I could find on the day I visited. Only Hilton wifi was found. So I had to end up using my cell as a hotspot to connect.  Booo.

owner_response.author: Harlie J, Public Relations Manager at Eau Claire Downtown Coffee, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Laura! Thanks for leaving a review. On the far left of our chalkboard you can find the network username and coupon code to be able to take advantage of our free wifi through Hilton. I apologize that you had trouble with seating. Behind the fireplace there are additional chairs and tables that may not be noticeable at first glance. We appreciate you stopping by!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice coffee in the downtown area
data.text: I stopped here to grab a cup of coffee while I worked. As far as atmosphere goes, the space feels very empty and, despite having a fireplace, is not cozy at all. I ordered a latte and was given the wrong size (oops; chalk it up to new staff); it was a strong cup, but good. I think it was a little overpriced. They do have free wifi and plenty of seating. I would visit again if I was in the downtown area, but this definitely isn't the best place for coffee in Eau Claire.

owner_response.author: Harlie J, Public Relations Manager at Eau Claire Downtown Coffee, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello! Thanks for stopping by ECDC! Luckily, our SuperMonks art installation has now been installed, so our walls are now covered with some great work from a local artist. Thanks again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good Cinnamon Rolls
data.text: While staying at the Lismore hotel we stopped in here two mornings to grab a quick bite.  I had the cinnamon rolls and one of the wraps.  Both were okay.  I felt the pricing was a little higher, however.

data.title: Great Coffee
data.text: If you enjoy a stronger cup of coffee this is the place to go! The staff has always been friendly whenever I go, and the coffee is tasty too!

owner_response.author: Harlie J, Public Relations Manager at Eau Claire Downtown Coffee, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review! We take pride in our artisan coffee from the local wholesale coffee roaster, Roastery 7. See you around!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Hip Coffee Shop
data.text:
I visited EC*DC with a friend for lunch in June. The new, Hip décor is attractive for lunch, grabbing some coffee, or hanging out with friends/coworkers. There is outdoor seating as well!

The coffee was pretty good, as you'd expect from a *real* coffee shop. Service was prompt and friendly.

The food selection is limited, but again as you'd expect from a coffee shop. Several hot and cold sandwich selections and salads. Both eat-in as well as grab-and-go. There was a decent selection of premium baked goods selection.

EC*DC is certainly one of the premier coffee establishments and mid-day hangouts in Eau Claire. I will definitely return often.

owner_response.author: Harlie J, Public Relations Manager at Eau Claire Downtown Coffee, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello! Thanks for stopping for lunch at ECDC and leaving a review. We look forward to seeing your around!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Coffee
data.text: A wonderful addition to the coffee scene downtown. The espresso is  delicious. Well made drinks. Although it's part of a hotel , it's truly separated from that. Pastries are ok. But the sandwich and wrap offerings are very good.

data.title: Nothing on Racy's
data.text: While the coffee is good, it doesn't rival other local options. Prices are competitive but the Americano is .50 more than straight espresso and let's face it, all an Americano is is espresso with  water. The atmosphere is really cool though, and unlike anything else in Eau Claire. I'd go back when downtown.
